intro: Psephellus gilanicus, commonly known as the Gilan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caspian region of Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
